questions.question: Which oxide in cement is primarily responsible for strength development?

explanations.c: Calcium oxide (CaO) reacts with water to form hydration compounds responsible for strength development in cement.

questions.question: What is the role of SO₃ in cement composition?

explanations.b: SO₃ (Sulfur Trioxide) helps prevent flash setting, which occurs due to the rapid hydration of C₃A (Tricalcium Aluminate).

questions.question: Which oxide in cement contributes to early strength and lowers clinkering temperature?

explanations.b: Al₂O₃ (Alumina) reduces the clinkering temperature and promotes early strength development in cement.

questions.question: Which oxide helps in preventing alkali-silica reaction (ASR)?

explanations.d: Na₂O and K₂O (alkali oxides) react with silica in aggregates, causing ASR. Controlling their content prevents this reaction.

questions.question: What is the main function of Fe₂O₃ in cement?

answers.c: Assists in clinker formation and impacts color

explanations.c: Fe₂O₃ (Iron Oxide) helps in clinker formation and gives cement its characteristic gray color.

questions.question: What is the purpose of adding ammonium oxalate ((NH₄)₂C₂O₄) during the determination of CaO?

explanations.a: Ammonium oxalate is used to precipitate calcium as calcium oxalate, which is further analyzed for CaO content.

questions.question: Why is nitric acid (HNO₃) used in the determination of SiO₂ in cement?

answers.c: To acidify the solution and convert silica into insoluble form

explanations.c: Nitric acid acidifies the solution and helps convert silica (SiO₂) into an insoluble form for precise determination.

questions.question: What is the key method for determining the percentage of Fe₂O₃ in cement?

explanations.a: Titration using KMnO₄ (Potassium Permanganate) is commonly used for Fe₂O₃ determination due to its oxidizing properties.

questions.question: What compound is precipitated to determine the MgO content in cement?

explanations.b: Magnesium ammonium phosphate (MgNH₄PO₄) is the compound formed and precipitated for MgO content determination.

questions.question: What is the function of tetracalcium aluminoferrite (C₄AF) in cement?

answers.b: Improves workability but contributes minimal strength

explanations.b: C₄AF (Tetracalcium Aluminoferrite) mainly improves workability and has a minor role in strength development.

questions.question: What is the main reason for using low-heat cement in mass concrete structures?

answers.b: It reduces the risk of thermal cracking

explanations.b: Low-heat cement generates less heat during hydration, reducing the risk of thermal cracking in large structures.
